data.text:
Condon at the 71st Academy Awards 2 Nominations / 1 Win Role Director, Screenwriter Born October 22, 1955 New York City, New York, USA

Bill Condon is an American screenwriter and director. Condon is best known for directing and writing the critically acclaimed films Gods and Monsters, Chicago, Kinsey, Dreamgirls and the two final installments of the Twilight series, The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn – Part 1 and The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn – Part 2.

Wins[]

71st Academy Awards, 1998

Best Adapted Screenplay — Gods and Monsters

Nominations[]

71st Academy Awards, 1998

Best Adapted Screenplay — Gods and Monsters
